website_summaries.verdict: The LinkStation LS420 is inexpensive for a two-bay NAS and very speedy in read and write performance, but it's plagued by software issues.
pros: Dual bays offer drive-mirroring for fault tolerance
cons: Remote Access is tricky to configure

customer_reviews.title: Support great - Had drive failure and they were great.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this for a client in 2014. Just had a drive go out and they were having issues with their backup. The tech support work with me to get the drive diagnosed, sent to a drive recovery service and get a discount on that service. Excellent service and I am ordering another Buffalo unit for my client. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: IceMan

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for an affordable NAS setup.
customer_reviews.text: This drive is exactly what you would expect. It was fairly easy to set up but I would not say fool proof. The interface is poor and the directions even poorer. Other than that once you get it configured it works great and is highly reliable. Mine is still running strong after about 6 months. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for an affordable NAS setup.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Has it's issues.
customer_reviews.text: This is a little tricky to use. I hooked this to my router so that it could be accessed on my network. However, when I try to put many documents on it, it disappears and I am no longer able to see it on the network. I just need to spend a weekend figuring out what is wrong with it and see if I can get it working.
customer_reviews.author: R N

customer_reviews.title: Works fine and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and easy setup. Worked exactly as advertised out of the box. No problems at all after a couple of months in operation. I own other Link Stations and all of them have been excellent. They are on line 24/7 and some of my older ones have run for years without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Good NAS
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a client to replace an old file server. This thing had 10x the disk space as their old server, and was much faster. They use it just for file sharing in their office. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nush

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS device
customer_reviews.text: Great NAS device. Had my main machine die on me and didn't care because all my data is now stored on this!
customer_reviews.author: Columbus Washboard Co

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but NOT if you want to user Windows 7 and offline files
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased 5 LinkStations over the years and all worked well with Windows offline synchronization. Until now. This unit does not support Windows 7 offline files. The old units do, but not this one. If you don't need offline files then I'm sure this one will be fine. I've never had a reliability issue with a Linkstation.
customer_reviews.author: JeffL

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive Failure - RAID array is in degraded mode
customer_reviews.text: Second Hard Drive started failing two months after purchase. I get an error message that states "The RAID array is in degraded mode" and it says that Disk 2 has failed. I've started the process of replacing the disk under warranty, but it's really annoying that it has happened this soon. Otherwise I was already loving the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: After having a DriveStation with noisy vibrating drives that Buffalo refused to replace with an alternate product, and Amazon graciously accepted the return of, I received the LinkStation 420 with bad firmware, to which buffalo responded that I should return the product to Amazon for a replacement. So in two different cases Buffalo's tech support has been an epic fail and Amazon has come through. So now I'm scrambling to find a valid alternative to Buffalo. Thanks Amazon for amazing service as always.
customer_reviews.author: Luke M.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and support is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This unit failed on me within a year. The system gave me a message that it needed a firmware update in order to continue working. When I made the firmware update, the update never completed. I have spent a year trying to recover my data. No luck. Buffalo Customer Service will not help. I have since found that many others have this same problem where the NAS becomes a brick. Many have to throw the unit away. I do not recommend this solution to be used as a backup. It is not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: David Ralph

product_meta.title: Buffalo LinkStation 420 2 TB 2-Drive NAS for Home/Home Office (LS420D0202)
product_meta.description: Buffalo's LinkStation 420 network storage provides ultra fast shared storage and backup for all PC and Mac computers on your home network with the security of RAID data protection. Simply connect it to your wireless router for access anywhere in your home. Equipped with a high performance processor, LinkStation 420 boasts transfer speeds up to 80 MB/s, twice as fast as a standard NAS or USB drive. Additionally, it's DLNA Certified and it can be used as an iTunes server for simplified media storage and streaming. While on the go, easy to use WebAccess service allows you to create a free personal cloud for easy remote access anytime, anywhere over the Internet, and even on your iPhone, iPad and Android devices. With LinkStation 420, you can back up multiple computers simultaneously and enjoy uninterrupted access to terabytes of storage anytime, anywhere.
feature_bullets: High Performance Processor (transfers up to 100 M/bs)
Buffalo's free WebAcess to your own Personal Cloud
DLNA certified to stream your favorite media
Nova BACKUP software included for up 5 licenses
